name: Suspenseful throughout
reviewBody: In BEHIND ENEMY LINES, Owen Wilson is shot down in Bosnia and hunted by the Serbian army. Gene Hackman plays an admiral willing to sacrifice his career to rescue Wilson, but all does not go as planned. Like BAT*21 before it (also starring Hackman, but in the shot-down role), LINES makes a concerted effort to show us one man trying to survive in an extremely hostile landscape, during a war to boot. We all saw the Serbs gunning down ethnic Albanians on TV and read about their atrocities. This film brings that all-too-recent war back to life. The special effects are absolutely eye-popping, although how Wilson survives hundreds of people shooting at him is a bit much to take. A great ending, similar to that of BAT*21. See both films to compare and contrast, especially to witness how far special effects have come in a few short years.
